title: How to Start the Control Panel from the Command Line

steps.title: Open the Start menu.
steps.content: Open the Start menu. To do so, either click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen, or press the ⊞ Win key. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source On Windows 8, you'll instead hover your mouse in the top-right corner of the screen, then click the magnifying glass icon.

steps.title: Type command prompt into Start.
steps.content: Type command prompt into Start. This will bring up the Command Prompt icon at the top of the Start window.

steps.title: Click Command Prompt.
steps.content: Click Command Prompt . It's a black box at the top of the Start window. Doing so invokes a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Type start control into Command Prompt.
steps.content: Type start control into Command Prompt. This command will call up the Control Panel program when you run it.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . Doing so will run your command. After a brief moment, Control Panel will open. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source
